dīghāyu：dīghāyu（na）
ဒီဃာယု（န）
[dīgha+āyu．（dīhāu-prā）]
[ဒီဃ+အာယု။ （ဒီဟာဥ-ပြာ）]

Dīghāyu：1．Dīghāyu （Dīghāvu）.-Son of Dīghīti，king of Kosala．After his parents had been cruelly murdered by Brahmadatta，king ofKāsi，he became the attendant of this kind； in order to avenge their death，but when the occasion arose he made peace with Brahmadatta．His father’s kingdom was restored to him，and he married Brahmadatta’s daughter （Vin.i.343ff； DhA.i.46f； J.iii.211f，487）．He was the Bodhisatta （J.iii.490）.

2．Dīghāyu.-See āyuvaddhana.

3．Dīghāyu.-A Sākiyan prince，grandson of Amitodana and brother of Bhaddakaccānā．He went to Ceylon and there founded a settlement which he named after himself．His son was Dīghagāmanī．Mhv.ix.10f； 18； Dpv.x.6，8.

dīghāyu：ဒီဃာယု（န）
[ဒီဃ+အာယု။ （ဒီဟာဥ-ပြာ）]
（၁） ရှည်သော အသက်။ （၂） အသက်ရှည်ခြင်း၊ အသက်ရှည်မှု။ （တ） （၃） ရှည်သော အသက်ရှိသော၊ အသက်ရှည်သော၊ သူ။

dīghāyu：ဒီဃာယု （တိ） （ဒီဃ+အာယု）
ရှည်သောအသက်ရှိသည်။
